qas.question: The earliest device to help count was what?
Calculi during the Fertile Crescent refers to what?

context: Devices have been used to aid computation for thousands of years, mostly using one-to-one correspondence with fingers. The earliest counting device was probably <a0_0>a form of tally stick<a0_0/>. Later record keeping aids throughout the Fertile Crescent included calculi <a1_0>(clay spheres, cones, etc.)<a1_0/> which represented counts of items, probably livestock or grains, sealed in hollow unbaked clay containers. The use of counting rods is one example.
